intro: Atylus drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like buttercups and anemones. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Atylus drummondii is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs.
